column4: hard to beat gstreamer for media conversion though... was playing with it the other day
I cannot even play an mpeg-file with totem ...
do you have totem-xine installed?
If I install totem-xine, totem wont start ...
I wonder why it worked when I made an installation some days ago ...
not sure - try running it on a command line and see if you get error messages
believe it or not: It lacks libnautilus-cdburn.so.0 (or something like that)
uh... for burning CDs in totem? I don't follow
if you can get the output from totem I might be able to help you track down the problem
It simply says "cannot find shared library libnautilus-burncd.so.0" (or cdburn, I do not remember)
does that file exist on your system?
I'll take a look ... to sec
The right message is: "totem: error while loading shared libraries: libnautilus-burn.so.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
does /usr/lib/libnautilus-burn.so.0 exist on your system?
there are files called blablabla.1 and blablabla.1.0.0 but not blablabla.0
using hoary?
I am using 5.04
totem shouldn't be looking for .0 then.... try $ sudo apt-get install --reinstall totem-xine libnautilus-burn1
it's still the same. ..
hmmm, not sure... if you make a symlink of the correct name does it work?
It get's even more strange: totem: relocation error: totem: undefined symbol: bacon_cd_selection_new
